line_1: Come, kittle up your moorlan harp
line_2: My worthy friend, ne'er grudge an' carp,

line_1: Come, kittle up your moorlan harp
line_2: Tho' Fortune use you hard an' sharp;

line_1: Come, kittle up your moorlan harp
line_2: Ne'er mind how Fortune waft an' warp;

line_1: When DAVID, the Bethlemite, play'd on the Harp:
line_2: How SAUL was restor'd, tho' his Sorrow was sharp,
